member.name: T:VL.Stride.Assets.IDispatcherService
member.summary: This interface allows to dispatch execution of a portion of code in the thread where it was created, usually the Main thread.

member.name: M:VL.Stride.Assets.IDispatcherService.Invoke(System.Action)
member.summary: Executes the given callback in the dispatcher thread. This method will block until the execution of the callback is completed.
member.param: The callback to execute in the dispatcher thread.

member.name: M:VL.Stride.Assets.IDispatcherService.Invoke``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Executes the given callback in the dispatcher thread. This method will block until the execution of the callback is completed.
member.typeparam: The type of result returned by the callback.
member.param: The callback to execute in the dispatcher thread.
member.returns: The result returned by the executed callback.

member.name: M:VL.Stride.Assets.IDispatcherService.InvokeAsync(System.Action)
member.summary: Executes the given asynchronous function in the dispatcher thread. This method will run asynchronously and return immediately.
member.param: The asynchronous function to execute in the dispatcher thread.
member.returns: A task corresponding to the asynchronous execution of the given function.

member.name: M:VL.Stride.Assets.IDispatcherService.LowPriorityInvokeAsync(System.Action)
member.summary: Executes the given asynchronous function in the dispatcher thread. This method will run asynchronously and return immediately.
member.param: The asynchronous function to execute in the dispatcher thread.
member.returns: A task corresponding to the asynchronous execution of the given function.
member.remarks: This method uses a low priority to schedule the action on the dispatcher thread.

member.name: M:VL.Stride.Assets.IDispatcherService.InvokeAsync``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Executes the given asynchronous function in the dispatcher thread. This method will run asynchronously and return immediately.
member.typeparam: The type of result returned by the task.
member.param: The asynchronous function to execute in the dispatcher thread.
member.returns: A task corresponding to the asynchronous execution of the given task.

member.summary: Executes the given asynchronous task in the dispatcher thread. This method will run asynchronously and return immediately.

member.returns: A task corresponding to the asynchronous execution of the given function.

member.summary: Executes the given asynchronous task in the dispatcher thread. This method will run asynchronously and return immediately.
member.typeparam: The type of result returned by the task.
member.param: The asynchronous task to execute in the dispatcher thread.
member.returns: A task corresponding to the asynchronous execution of the given task.

member.summary: Ensures that the current thread is (or is not) the dispatcher thread. This method will throw an exception if it is not the case.

member.param: The ID of the namespace.
The name (within that namespace).
member.returns: A UUID derived from the namespace and name.

member.name: M:Faithlife.Utility.GuidUtility.Create(System.Guid,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a name-based UUID using the algorithm from RFC 4122 ยง4.3.
member.param: The ID of the namespace.
The name (within that namespace).
The version number of the UUID to create; this value must be either 3 (for MD5 hashing) or 5 (for SHA-1 hashing).
member.returns: A UUID derived from the namespace and name.

member.name: T:Upload
member.summary: This class contains methods excepted from Salient.Web.HttpLib.HttpRequestUtility for demonstration purposes. Please see http://salient.codeplex.com for full implementation

members.member:
Uploads a stream using a multipart/form-data POST.
A NameValueCollection containing form fields to post with file data An open, positioned stream containing the file data Optional, a name to assign to the file data. Optional. If omitted, registry is queried using . If content type is not available from registry, application/octet-stream will be submitted. Optional, a form field name to assign to the uploaded file data. If omitted the value 'file' will be submitted. Optional, can pass null. Used to send and retrieve cookies. Pass the same instance to subsequent calls to maintain state if required. Optional, headers to be added to request.
Reference: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1867 http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2388 http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/interact/forms.html#h-17.13.4.2

member.name: M:Upload.PostFile(System.Uri,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Net.CookieContainer,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Uploads a file using a multipart/form-data POST.
member.param: A NameValueCollection containing form fields to post with file data
The physical path of the file to upload
Optional. If omitted, registry is queried using . If content type is not available from registry, application/octet-stream will be submitted.
Optional, a form field name to assign to the uploaded file data. If omitted the value 'file' will be submitted.
Optional, can pass null. Used to send and retrieve cookies. Pass the same instance to subsequent calls to maintain state if required.
Optional, headers to be added to request.

member.name: M:Upload.TryGetContentType(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Attempts to query registry for content-type of supplied file name.
